text: Bruins sign Zdeno Chara to a one year contract extension worth $2 million, plus an additional $1.75 million in performance-based incentives.

text: It's correct because CBJ and MTL play against each other one more time, which means one team is guaranteed to get to 87 points and NYR can't catch either in ROW. NYR also can't catch CAR (87 points) in ROW. So 85 points is the mark.

text: I agree he should play more minutes to see what they have in him, but he needs to have a better offseason, a better training camp, etc. to really convince them he's the real deal. He didn't dominate in the AHL.
author: drosennhl

text: Yeah. So. Again, would you rather he coach to not make the playoffs? I don't get this line of thinking at all. Players play to win. Coaches coach to win.
author: drosennhl

text: Who is Mr. Met writing for these days?
author: drosennhl

text: Would you rather he coach to lose? He's coaching to win, because that's his job, why he was hired. He's coaching to make the team better, because they need to be better.
author: drosennhl

text: Flyers, Blackhawks, Sabres and Lightning will play regular season games in Europe next season as part of the 2019 NHL Global Series:

text: A Rangers housekeeping note for today -- They will be officially eliminated from playoff contention tonight IF the Canadiens beat the Islanders in any fashion AND the Blue Jackets get at least one point against the Oilers.

text: It’s about levels to me. The Blackhawks wouldn’t be near the playoff race without Kane. The Lightning wouldn’t be near this good without Kucherov, who has had a better season than anyone else in the NHL. He shouldn’t be punished because he plays on a better team.
author: drosennhl

text: Nikita Kucherov hasn’t made many false moves with the puck on his stick this season, but he kind of just did. It would most likely be 5-3 now if he passed to Tyler Johnson on the play that just happened. Either way, what a terrific hockey game this is.

text: The Islanders just announced that Valtteri Filppula is out four weeks with an upper-body injury and Jordan Eberle is day to day with an upper-body injury.

text: On Jimmy Howard, who is fine with one year contracts from here on out as long as he gets to keep wearing the winged wheel:
author: drosennhl

text: On the Islanders and why I think they’d be a tough playoff team, the Penguins and why it can go any way with them, the Predators with Watson and thoughts on their center depth, who could be the Kings next coach, and what could be next for the Rangers:
author: drosennhl

text: Blashill referenced that. He said it probably helped de la Rose figure something wasn't right tonight.
author: drosennhl

text: Jimmy Howard is close to signing a 1-year contract extension with the Red Wings. Howard said some language is being worked out, but it's going to get done. Ken Holland confirmed. Howard said he's fine with a 1-year deal. He had no desire to leave Detroit. "It's home," he said.
author: drosennhl

text: Detroit F Jacob de la Rose left the game at MSG tonight early because of an accelerated heartbeat. He was taken to a local hospital, where he'll spend the night. He is expected to return to Detroit tomorrow to see a specialist. A member of Detroit's medical staff is with him.
author: drosennhl

text: In other news tonight, in the second period in St. Louis, the Blues have four goals and the Oilers have five shots on goal.
author: drosennhl

text: I think so.
author: drosennhl

text: Second period. Second period. Second period. My bad.
author: drosennhl

text: Rangers killer Jimmy Howard is up to 30 saves with 5:17 left in the first period. The Red Wings goalie entered tonight 9-3-3 with a 1.75 GAA and .948 save percentage in 15 career appearances against the Rangers, the team he grew up rooting for.
author: drosennhl

text: A double positive.
author: drosennhl

text: Excuse me Mr. Officer.
author: drosennhl

text: The Rangers gave a very nice tribute to the late Harry Howell prior to puck drop tonight at MSG. It included a video of Howell from his playing days on the ice at the Garden thanking the fans for their support. Really well done for the late Hall of Famer.
author: drosennhl

text: David Quinn on Rangers rookie center Lias Andersson, the No. 7 pick in the 2017 draft who has played fewer than 11 minutes in nine of his 11 games since being recalled from Hartford:
author: drosennhl

text: David Quinn said he felt the Rangers lost their purpose on their four-game road trip, when they went 0-3-1. “I thought we caved a little bit to our situation." He said the last 10 games is about getting it back so they can feel better about their effort and the results.
author: drosennhl

text: ICYMI:
author: drosennhl

text: And then?
author: drosennhl

text: Catching up on Rangers with a game at MSG tonight. Watching David Quinn's presser from yesterday and this pops out from the coach: "You can help yourself or hurt yourself over these last 10 games. It's your choice." Fact: These games matter for this team in the stage its in.
author: drosennhl

text: Taking questions for the weekly mailbag. Send them my way. Use #OvertheBoards.
author: drosennhl

text: Just so impressive how the Lightning, with everything pretty much wrapped up, continue to win the way they do. No let up in this team.

text: Taking questions now for the weekly mailbag. Send them my way and use #OvertheBoards.

text: Ha. Would be a perfect episode.
author: drosennhl

text: Because Larry David and Jerry Seinfeld know reclining on an airplane is actually too preposterous.
author: drosennhl

text: I’m typically not passive about it.
author: drosennhl

text: Good luck.
author: drosennhl

text: Way too much thinking and looking. Just don’t recline. It’s the right way to fly.
author: drosennhl

text: You know one of these days you will sit in front of me on a flight and this will come to a head then.
author: drosennhl

text: Oh, it’s a big deal.
author: drosennhl

text: I’m not even tall. Average height here. It’s just a criminal offense to recline when there is a person in the seat behind you in coach and anybody who does should be tazed and immediately removed from the plane, ticket revoked, and any airline status they may have taken away.
author: drosennhl

text: I don’t say anything when someone reclines because I prefer people don’t talk to me on planes so I don’t talk to them. However, I relentlessly kick the back of their seat to make them as uncomfortable as me until they move up and realize the error they made.
author: drosennhl

text: Mark is correct. Listen to the man.
author: drosennhl

text: Do you think the extra six inches you gain by reclining is worth it for the added “comfort” you get AND the complete and utter inconvenience and discomfort it causes the poor person sitting directly behind you, who now can’t do any work because of you? We need to have a chat.
author: drosennhl

text: Why I said mostly.
author: drosennhl

text: Don’t say this often, but from the tying goal in regulation to the winner for the Flyers in OT, that was mostly not Sidney Crosby’s finest few minutes. Took some chances that didn’t pay off. Happens. Great win for the Flyers.
author: drosennhl

text: Anybody know how Mike Sullivan feels about that too many men penalty?

text: How dare you go after a Reuben.
